sentence.Network_en: It would pay farmers to plough up the scrub and plant wheat.
sentence.Network_cn: 它会出钱雇农民开垦这块低矮丛林来种植麦子。

sentence.Network_en: This is early-20th-century rural Sussex, when horses still pulled the plough.
sentence.Network_cn: 这是20世纪早期的萨塞克斯乡村，那时还是用马拉犁。

sentence.Network_en: The soil sticks to the blade and blocks the plough.
sentence.Network_cn: 土粘在犁铧上，卡住了犁。

phrase.cizu_name: plough a lonely (或 one's own) furrow

jx.jx_en_mean: follow a course of action in which one is isolated or in which one can act independently
jx.jx_cn_mean: 孤独无援地行动，我行我素

phrase.cizu_name: put (或 set) one's hand to the plough

jx.jx_en_mean: plough grass or other material into the soil to enrich it
jx.jx_cn_mean: 把（草或其他材料）犁入土中做肥料

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Old English plōh, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch ploeg and German Pflug. The spelling plough became common in England in the 18th cent.; earlier (16th–17th cents) the noun was normally spelled plough, the verb plow

entry.def: A plough is a large farming tool with sharp blades which is pulled across the soil to turn it over, usually before seeds are planted.
When someone ploughs an area of land, they turn over the soil using a plough.

example.ex: They ploughed nearly 100,000 acres of virgin moorland.
example.tran: 他们犁了将近10万英亩未开垦的高沼地。

entry.def: If an area of land is under the plough, it is used for growing crops. If land is brought or put under the plough, it is ploughed for the first time and is then used for growing crops.

example.ex: There was not one inch of soil that was not under the plough.
example.tran: 没有一寸土地未被开垦成耕地。

example.ex: ...as we put more and more wilderness under the plough.
example.tran: 随着我们将越来越多的荒地开垦成耕地

means.word_mean: 1. a farm tool having one or more heavy blades to break the soil and cut a furrow prior to sowing
1. move in a way resembling that of a plow cutting into or going through the soil;
2. to break and turn over earth especially with a plow;

sentences.sentence: "Farmer Jones plowed his east field last week"

auth_sentence.content: You'd think then, it'd be plough-through-the-pain adventure.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: You'd think then, it'd be plough-through-the-pain adventure.

sentences.en: Ploughs are pulled by tractors, or in some countries by oxen.
sentences.cn: 犁由拖拉机牵引, 在一些国家则用牛来拉。

sentences.en: We possess ten acres of plough.
Farmers plough in autumn or spring.
sentences.cn: 农民在秋天或春天犁田。

sentences.en: The peasants were ploughing the field.

means.word_mean: 开路; 破浪前进; 艰苦前进

sentences.en: The great ship ploughed across the ocean.
sentences.cn: 巨轮在大洋中破浪前进。

sentences.en: Our gunboats are ploughing the waves.
sentences.cn: 我军炮艇正在破浪前进。

jushi.english: He that by the plough would thrive himself must either hold or drive.
jushi.chinese: 想靠犁杖过好日子的人必须亲自扶犁或亲自驾驭牲口。

jushi.english: All were busily engaged, men at their ploughs, women at their looms.
jushi.chinese: 大家都很忙,男的耕田,女的织布。

jushi.english: He has a very large acreage under the plough.
